title: What's fueling the sharp rise in PSU profitability over the past five years?
summary: Public sector undertakings (PSUs) have demonstrated significant financial improvement, with their share of net profit in the ET 500 rankings expanding sharply to 30.7% in FY25 from 17.9% in FY19.  PSUs also outpaced non-PSUs in sales and profit growth, showcasing a robust financial turnaround.

title: Indorama gets Rs 670 crore DBS trade facility
summary: DBS Bank India has provided Indorama India, a subsidiary of Indorama Corp, with a ₹670 crore sustainability-linked trade facility. This loan aims to promote sustainable manufacturing in eastern India's fertiliser sector by incentivizing reductions in greenhouse gas emissions, water use, and energy intensity.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian equities rebounded for a second consecutive session on Monday, buoyed by a stronger rupee and broad-based buying interest. Analysts anticipate continued market stability, supported by favorable global cues. The Nifty is expected to remain bullish above 25,900, with immediate resistance at 26,315.

title: Stocks in news: Adani Total Gas, Indian Hotels, LIC Housing, Berger Paints, Ramco Cements
summary: Markets advanced nearly a percent, extending Friday's rebound, with Nifty facing resistance around 26,200-26,300. Analysts suggest a positive bias with buying opportunities on dips. Several companies like Adani Total Gas, Indian Hotels, and LIC Housing Finance are in focus due to significant news developments, including CFO appointments, international hotel signings, and reduced home loan interest rates.

title: Will MUFG's 20% stake propel Shriram Finance to new all-time highs?
summary: Shriram Finance shares surged to an all-time high after Japan's MUFG Bank announced its acquisition of a 20% stake. Analysts have raised price targets, citing the deal's positive impact on the NBFC's growth outlook and debt repayment confidence. The investment is expected to accelerate diversification plans and bring valuable expertise.

title: Asian cues, foreign fund flows spur a 'Santa Rally' on D-Street
summary: Indian equity indices surged on Monday, mirroring gains across Asia, driven by a strengthening rupee and renewed foreign investment. The Nifty and Sensex closed higher, with the broader market also showing strength. Analysts attribute the upward trend to a 'Santa rally' phenomenon, with midcap and smallcap stocks leading the advance.

title: Stock Radar: City Union Bank stock hits fresh record high in December 2025; what should investors do?
summary: City Union Bank stock experienced a significant 5-year breakout on monthly charts in November, continuing its rally into December and reaching fresh record highs. Experts suggest short-term traders can target Rs 300 in the coming weeks, citing strong technical indicators and a positive chart pattern.

title: Gross FDI slips to $6.5 billion, net flows negative
summary: Foreign direct investment into India saw a slight dip in October. Net FDI continued to show outflows, though less than the previous month. Singapore, Mauritius, and the United States were the top contributors to these inflows.

title: Outward remittances under LRS flat at $2.36 billion
summary: Indians sent $2.36 billion abroad in October under the Liberalised Remittance Scheme. Travel spending was $1.35 billion. Investments in equity and debt saw a significant jump. However, spending on studies abroad decreased compared to last year. The Reserve Bank of India manages this scheme for resident individuals.

title: Provision in new Insurance Bill sparks fears of board shake-ups
summary: A new insurance law provision raises concerns for directors. It may force many to step down from insurance boards. This impacts bank-promoted ventures where directors also serve lenders. The current wording could lead to confusion and board instability. Insurers seek clarification to avoid disruption. This change aims for better governance but might create unintended consequences for existing structures.

title: 'Focus on fundamentals to keep India going': RBI Bulletin
summary: India's economy is set for strong growth. The Reserve Bank of India predicts 7.3% GDP expansion for FY 2025-26. This is driven by robust domestic demand and easing inflation. Reforms and strong fundamentals are key to navigating global challenges. Private consumption and investment are boosting growth. Net exports remain a challenge due to trade tariffs.

title: Unity Small Finance Bank wins 3-way auction for Aviom India Housing Finance
summary: Six companies had shown interest in acquiring Aviom India Housing Finance under the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT)-monitored process but eventually three of them participated at the challenge auction process that concluded last week.

title: Boeing eyes higher output as Air India, Akasa await bulk jet deliveries
summary: Boeing will boost narrow-body jet production to 47 a month starting next year. The move aims to enhance delivery efficiency and support the growth of Indian airlines facing supply chain challenges.

title: Chinese Airlines See Hopes Dim for Profit Return With Japan Spat
summary: The standoff between China and Japan threatens to exacerbate a seasonally weak period for Chinese airlines and make it harder for them to post their first annual profit in six years.

summary: Five NSE largecap stocks showed improving momentum on December 22 as their RSI readings moved above the 50 mark. This shift indicates strengthening price action and early accumulation. title: ET 500 Wealth Creators: Who topped the charts and who suffered losses?

Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles lost 52% market capitalization. Jindal Saw reported a 45.4% erosion in market cap due to subdued demand.

title: MCX India, Ashok Leyland and 4 other midcap stocks witness 5-year swing high
summary: Six NSE midcap stocks touched a 5-year swing high at the close on December 22, indicating strengthening bullish momentum. A swing high marks the highest price over a five-year period and often reflects sustained buying interest. While distinct from a long-term breakout, such moves may signal trend continuation.

title: 2026 Global Markets: Navigating the new regime of debt, inflation and geopolitical shifts
summary: Global markets face a regime shift with elevated debt, fiscal dominance, and geopolitical fragmentation. Financial repression, favoring nominal growth and inflation, is likely. Investors should pivot to real assets like commodities, gold, and silver, and select equities, as old frameworks prove insufficient.

title: Belrise Industries shares in focus as promoter set to offload over 6% stake via block deal
summary: Belrise Industries shares are set to remain in focus as promoter group entity Sumedh Tools plans a Rs 897 crore block deal to sell a 6.56% stake. The transaction marks the first major secondary sale since the company’s May 2025 IPO, drawing investor attention.

title: 2026 Investment Strategy: Spread bets, buy on dips
summary: Wealth managers are advising investors to temper return expectations for equities in 2026, suggesting a balanced portfolio of 65% equities, 25% debt, and 10% precious metals. Concerns over US tariffs, rupee depreciation, and IPO liquidity are prompting caution, with a recommendation to stagger equity investments and avoid chasing recent performance.

title: ET 500 companies hit record margins in FY25 despite sluggish revenue growth
summary: Indian companies in the ET 500 group saw record profits in FY25. Revenue grew steadily, but companies focused on controlling costs. This led to higher operating and net margins. Debt levels also decreased, improving financial health. The ET 500's contribution to India's GDP remained significant. These results highlight strong corporate performance.

title: Asian stocks rise, extending record global rally
summary: Asian stocks advanced for a second day, mirroring Wall Street's bullish momentum and signaling a year-end rally. The MSCI Asia Pacific index rose, with Japan's Topix also climbing. This positive sentiment, driven by technical factors and stimulus optimism, is setting the stage for a strong finish to the year and a solid start to the next.

The cutoff income for the 500th company has also risen, indicating growth in corporate India's scale of operations.

title: Gopal Vittal, the CEO who grew Airtel's market cap roughly  ₹1 trn annually for 12 years on the trot
summary: Bharti Airtel MD &amp; CEO Gopal Vittal will transition to executive vice chairman in 2026, overseeing digital initiatives and talent management. Under his watch, Airtel navigated intense competition, maintained market strength, and grew valuation dramatically despite challenges from the likes of Jio.

title: KSH International shares list at 4% discount to IPO price on BSE, NSE
summary: KSH International listed at a nearly 4% discount to its IPO price, reflecting muted investor sentiment after the issue saw just 83% subscription. The company cut its OFS size post-issue to support smoother allotment. Despite strong fundamentals, valuation concerns dominated demand across non-institutional and retail categories.

title: GPT Infraprojects shares zoom 6% after being declared L1 bidder for Rs 670 crore NHAI project
summary: GPT Infraprojects shares: The company emerged as the L1 bidder for a Rs 670 crore NHAI infrastructure project. The order was secured through a consortium with ISCPPL and disclosed in a regulatory filing.

title: Auto stocks rally up to 140% in 2025. How smooth will the road be in 2026?
summary: India's auto sector is experiencing a robust rally, driven by a significant GST rate reduction in September. This policy shift has spurred broad-based demand across passenger vehicles, two-wheelers, tractors, and commercial vehicles. Auto ancillaries are outperforming, fueled by strong exports and EV component growth, setting a positive outlook for 2026.

title: Sensex slips over 100 pts, Nifty below 26,200 as foreign outflows halt 2-day rally
summary: Indian equities opened lower on Tuesday, breaking a two-day rally as foreign investors resumed selling. The Sensex and Nifty saw slight declines, with analysts anticipating thin trading volumes as the year concludes. The market awaits fresh catalysts ahead of the year-end.

title: SBI, Varun Beverages among Axis Securities’ top 9 stock picks for 2026, up to 23% upside seen
summary: Axis Securities forecasts the Nifty 50 to reach 28,100 by December 2026, anticipating a robust earnings-led growth phase for Indian equities. The brokerage has identified nine top stock picks, including SBI and Varun Beverages, with potential upside up to 23%, driven by strong fundamentals and earnings visibility.

title: HNI demand didn’t save them: 12 heavily subscribed IPOs of 2025 are still underwater
summary: India's IPO market is facing a harsh reality check as nearly half of the 102 listings in 2025 are trading below their issue price. Even strong demand from High Net Worth Individuals (HNIs) failed to protect 12 heavily subscribed IPOs, which are now underwater, highlighting issues beyond subscription frenzy.

title: Ola Electric shares in focus after clarification on promoter stake sale for debt repayment
summary: Ola Electric shares: The company clarified that promoter Bhavish Aggarwal’s Rs 324 crore stake sale was a one-time move to repay debt. The proceeds were used to fully repay a Rs 260 crore promoter-level loan, including interest, and to release all pledged promoter shares.

title: Reliance Power among 4 Nifty500 stocks closing below VWAP
summary: On December 22, four Nifty500 stocks closed more than 1.5% below their VWAP levels, signalling potential bearish pressure. Closing below VWAP indicates the stock ended the session beneath its volume-weighted average price, reflecting rising selling interest and weakening intraday sentiment among market participants.

title: Ram Ratna Wires shares approach ex-date for 1:1 bonus issue. Do you own?
summary: December 23 is the last day to buy Ram Ratna Wires shares to qualify for its 1:1 bonus issue. The record date is December 26, and with December 25 being a market holiday, the stock will turn ex-bonus on December 24. Investors must purchase shares by the close on December 23 to be eligible.

title: Ambuja Cements, Orient Cement shares zoom up to 10% following board approval for merger with Orient Cement
summary: Ambuja Cements is embarking on an exciting merger with ACC Ltd and Orient Cement Ltd, a move designed to create a robust and unified cement platform across the Indian landscape. By merging, the companies aim to boost efficiency and refine their corporate framework.

title: Nuvama Wealth Management shares to trade ex-split from Dec 24. Last day to buy for eligibility
summary: Nuvama Wealth Management’s 1:5 stock split enters its final eligibility window, with December 23 set as the last day to buy shares. The record date is December 26, while December 24 will be the ex-split date due to the Christmas market holiday and the T+1 settlement cycle.

title: Indian investors bet on earnings revival to power stock gains
summary: Indian investors are positioning for an earnings revival in 2026 after domestic equities underperformed Asian peers in 2025. Expectations of tax relief, interest-rate cuts and stronger corporate profits are driving optimism. Banks, autos and capital goods led gains, while exporters, realty and media stocks lagged amid currency weakness.

title: DCM Shriram demerger: Last day to buy the shares for eligibility
summary: DCM Shriram Industries’ demerger enters its final eligibility phase, with December 23 set as the last day to buy shares under the revised record date of December 26. The stock will trade ex-demerger from December 24, ahead of the Christmas trading holiday, determining shareholder entitlement to the new entities.

summary: JPMorgan Chase ‍is considering offering cryptocurrency ​trading to its institutional clients, Bloomberg News reported ⁠on Monday, underscoring Wall Street banks' growing participation in the digital assets sector.
